alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 15 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of central and northern Vermont except the immediate Champlain Valley and Champlain Islands. Essex County in New York. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rain and embedded thunderstorms associated with an approaching frontal system will bring a renewed threat of flash flooding across much of Vermont and Essex County New York on Sunday. Lingering impacts of high water may linger through Sunday night. Total rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2.0 inches are expected, with locally higher amounts with thunderstorm activity. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
